title: What are some songs that musicians came to regret or hate? - Quora

response.answer_text: I’ve played in many cover bands during the last 40 years. The biggest requests back in the 70s and 80s were “Free Bird” by Lynryd Skynyrd, and “Cocaine” by Eric Clapton. We’ll still get the occasional request for “Free Bird”, but it’s usually coming from someone who is just trying to funny and annoying at the same time. But we played them so many times we eventually flat-out refused to play them any longer. Walk into a guitar store back then, and all you’d hear was “Smoke On The Water” by Deep Purple, and “Stairway To Heaven” by Led Zeppelin. And they were usually played very badly by every wannabe guitarist that ever lived. Having played in my share of wedding bands over the years, we’ve gotten quite sick of playing the following songs: “Brown Eyed Girl” by Van Morrison; “Mustang Sally” by Wilson Pickett; “The Electric Slide” by Marcia Griffiths; “Brick House” by The Commodores; and “Play That Funky Music” by Wild Cherry. I’m sure there were others that have thankfully been erased from my memory! More recently (in the last 10 years) I’ve really gotten sick of playing “Santeria” by Sublime. Thank God we don’t play that one anymore! There are sooooo many songs that you just get sick of hearing that were force-fed by radio stations (I’m old, we didn’t have Spotify, iTunes, playlists, etc). So many songs, too many to mention, where as soon as you hear the first notes come over the radio you immediately changed the station!!! Even songs that you once loved you’d become sick of. Some songs you get over and then enjoy them later. Others you become sick of for the rest of your life! LOL

MEGADETH - “Crush ‘em” (Megadeth doing a disco sports anthem. Of all things… The title and intent came not from them, but from their manager at the time Bud Prager. And the fallout was immediate; Mustaine reportedly “threw the doors to their studio open and wretched.” As he put it, he envisioned “KISS in spandex trying to justify ‘I Was Made For Loving You’”, and he was horrified. Drummer Jimmy Degrasso openly despised the song. And so did everyone else in the end.)CRADLE OF FILTH - “From the Cradle to Enslave” (unlike the above entry, this is a song that was created and masterminded by the band itself, but thst didn't save it from being a song front man Dani Filth actively loathes. To his credit it's not a very good track; they've done better before and after this, and the whole EP this came from is probably the worst thing they ever made, but the unfortunate issue here is that this is, even today I believe, their closing live song. As Dani himself puts it: “We have to play it at every gig... I'd like to erase it, so I wouldn't have to play it again. After a while you just want to play something different. There's something about the hook that just strikes a chord of fear down my spine.")
